verses.text: O \sc Lord\sc*, rebuke me not in thine anger, Neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.
Have mercy upon me, O \sc Lord\sc*; for I \add am\add* weak: O \sc Lord\sc*, heal me; for my bones are vexed.
My soul is also sore vexed: But thou, O \sc Lord\sc*, how long?
Return, O \sc Lord\sc*, deliver my soul: O save me for thy mercyâ€™s sake.
For in death \add there is\add* no remembrance of thee: In the grave who shall give thee thanks?
I am weary with my groaning; All the night make I my bed to swim; I water my couch with my tears.
Mine eye is consumed because of grief; It waxeth old because of all mine enemies.
Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity; For the \sc Lord\sc* hath heard the voice of my weeping.
The \sc Lord\sc* hath heard my supplication; The \sc Lord\sc* will receive my prayer.
Let all mine enemies be ashamed and sore vexed: Let them return \add and\add* be ashamed suddenly.
